trans-unit.source: Get the same Office 365 experience on any device with Azure RemoteApp
trans-unit.target: Get the same Office 365 experience on any device with Azure RemoteApp

trans-unit.source: Learn how to share any Office 365 app with your users by using Azure RemoteApp.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to share any Office 365 app with your users by using Azure RemoteApp.

trans-unit.source: Get the same Office 365 experience on any device with Azure RemoteApp
trans-unit.target: Get the same Office 365 experience on any device with Azure RemoteApp

trans-unit.source: This article will cover how to deploy Office 365 on any device in your company.
trans-unit.target: This article will cover how to deploy Office 365 on any device in your company.

trans-unit.source: Your users can get the same capabilities and UI experience on Android, Apple and Windows.
trans-unit.target: Your users can get the same capabilities and UI experience on Android, Apple and Windows.

trans-unit.source: We will accomplish this using Azure RemoteApp by hosting Office 365 on scale-able virtual machines in Azure that users can connect to.
trans-unit.target: We will accomplish this using Azure RemoteApp by hosting Office 365 on scale-able virtual machines in Azure that users can connect to.

trans-unit.source: This set of virtual machines we call a "cloud collection".
trans-unit.target: This set of virtual machines we call a "cloud collection".

trans-unit.source: Create a cloud collection
trans-unit.target: Create a cloud collection

trans-unit.source: First after you have created an Azure account, navigate to RemoteApp by clicking on the link on the left side.
trans-unit.target: First after you have created an Azure account, navigate to RemoteApp by clicking on the link on the left side.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Showing Azure RemoteApp on the Azure Portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Showing Azure RemoteApp on the Azure Portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Then continue by clicking new on the bottom and "quick creating" a collection.
trans-unit.target: Then continue by clicking new on the bottom and "quick creating" a collection.

trans-unit.source: Provide a name, the region, the subscription, the plan and the image "Office Proffesional 2013" that we provide.
trans-unit.target: Provide a name, the region, the subscription, the plan and the image "Office Proffesional 2013" that we provide.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create Dialog</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create Dialog</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once you finish the form the collection creation process should start.
trans-unit.target: Once you finish the form the collection creation process should start.

trans-unit.source: This may take up to an hour or so.
trans-unit.target: This may take up to an hour or so.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Waiting</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Waiting</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once the process is done, it will look something like this.
trans-unit.target: Once the process is done, it will look something like this.

trans-unit.source: If we click Publishing we can see that most Office applications have been published for us already.
trans-unit.target: If we click Publishing we can see that most Office applications have been published for us already.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Collection created</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Collection created</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Published apps</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Published apps</linkText>

trans-unit.source: At this point you can also add more users that have access to this collection by clicking User Access.
trans-unit.target: At this point you can also add more users that have access to this collection by clicking User Access.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure user access</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure user access</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Now let's try out connecting to Office 365!
trans-unit.target: Now let's try out connecting to Office 365!

trans-unit.source: Connect to Office 365
trans-unit.target: Connect to Office 365

trans-unit.source: We'll head over to https://www.remoteapp.windowsazure.com/, scroll down and click Download clients to install the Azure RemoteApp client on the device you're on.
trans-unit.target: We'll head over to https://www.remoteapp.windowsazure.com/, scroll down and click Download clients to install the Azure RemoteApp client on the device you're on.

trans-unit.source: The screenshots below are for Windows.
trans-unit.target: The screenshots below are for Windows.

trans-unit.source: Once the application starts you'll be asked to sign in with your Microsoft account (formerly called a "Live ID"), use the same one as your Azure account for now.
trans-unit.target: Once the application starts you'll be asked to sign in with your Microsoft account (formerly called a "Live ID"), use the same one as your Azure account for now.

trans-unit.source: When you're signed in you should see a notification about new invitations, click there and you should see a list like one below.
trans-unit.target: When you're signed in you should see a notification about new invitations, click there and you should see a list like one below.

trans-unit.source: Accept the invitation that matches your Azure account owner email.
trans-unit.target: Accept the invitation that matches your Azure account owner email.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New invitation</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New invitation</linkText>

trans-unit.source: What it looks like when there are new invitations.
trans-unit.target: What it looks like when there are new invitations.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Accept an application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Accept an application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once you accept the invitation you should see all the Office apps in the Azure RemoteApp client.
trans-unit.target: Once you accept the invitation you should see all the Office apps in the Azure RemoteApp client.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>List of apps</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>List of apps</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When you click on any of these the application should start on the Azure virtual machine and you should be all set!
trans-unit.target: When you click on any of these the application should start on the Azure virtual machine and you should be all set!

trans-unit.source: Enjoy!
trans-unit.target: Enjoy!

trans-unit.source: <linkText>starting</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>starting</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>powerpoint</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>powerpoint</linkText>
